I believe we are ready to go beyond these programs--this kind
of support to individual projects--to the larger picture. To that
which will provide not only facilities and programming, but which
will provide personnel, services, training, ideas, materials in an
atmosphere of educational excellence finer than any we have even yet
learned to develop. To that which will guarantee the kind of growth
needed for all phases of communications, broadcasting and non-broad¬
casting, commercial and non-commercial, here and abroad.
Will you unite with ma today to call upon the communications
industry, upon the foundations, upon the federal government, and upon
the public join together to provide the funding and other
support to establish, in an international city such as Washington
or possibly New York City, a Communications University? A Univer¬
sity that I believe can be the cornerstone in a field that is most
important—that is most necessary for the peaceful, productive,
progressing future of our nation and of the world.
